DataElement.preferredName: SARS Coronavirus 2 Genome Variation Present Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Variants caused by gene mutations of SARS-CoV-2.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A positive-sense single-stranded RNA virus in the genus Betacoronavirus. It is the causative agent of the 2019-2020 severe acute respiratory syndrome outbreak._All of the differences in the complete genomic sequence of an organism when compared to a reference sequence._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A positive-sense single-stranded RNA virus in the genus Betacoronavirus. It is the causative agent of the 2019-2020 severe acute respiratory syndrome outbreak.:All of the differences in the complete genomic sequence of an organism when compared to a reference sequence.

Concepts.definition: A positive-sense single-stranded RNA virus in the genus Betacoronavirus. It is the causative agent of the 2019-2020 severe acute respiratory syndrome outbreak.
All of the differences in the complete genomic sequence of an organism when compared to a reference sequence.

Property.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A directive to specify when the listed responses are not sufficient.

Concepts.definition: A directive to specify when the listed responses are not sufficient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 that is the ancestor for the P.1 and P.2 lineages.

Concepts.definition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 that is the ancestor for the P.1 and P.2 lineages.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 where the following variations in the spike glycoprotein sequence have been identified: amino acid substitutions L18F, T20N, P26S, D138Y, R190S, K417T, E484K, N501Y, D614G, H655Y, T1027I and V1176F.

Concepts.definition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 where the following variations in the spike glycoprotein sequence have been identified: amino acid substitutions L18F, T20N, P26S, D138Y, R190S, K417T, E484K, N501Y, D614G, H655Y, T1027I and V1176F.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 where the following variations in the spike glycoprotein sequence have been identified: amino acid substitutions E484K, D614G and V1176F. The substitution F565L has also been detected in some but not all sequences for this lineage.

Concepts.definition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 where the following variations in the spike glycoprotein sequence have been identified: amino acid substitutions E484K, D614G and V1176F. The substitution F565L has also been detected in some but not all sequences for this lineage.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 where the following variations in the spike glycoprotein sequence have been identified: amino acid substitutions T19R, G142D, L452R, E484Q, D614G, P681R, D950N.

Concepts.definition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 where the following variations in the spike glycoprotein sequence have been identified: amino acid substitutions T19R, G142D, L452R, E484Q, D614G, P681R, D950N.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 where the following variations in the spike glycoprotein sequence have been identified: deletions of the amino acids at positions 156 and 157 and amino acid substitutions T19R, R158G, L452R, T478K, D614G, P681R and D950N. The substitution G142D has also been detected in some but not all sequences for this lineage.

Concepts.definition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 where the following variations in the spike glycoprotein sequence have been identified: deletions of the amino acids at positions 156 and 157 and amino acid substitutions T19R, R158G, L452R, T478K, D614G, P681R and D950N. The substitution G142D has also been detected in some but not all sequences for this lineage.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 where the following variations in the spike glycoprotein sequence have been identified: amino acid substitutions G142D, E154K, L452R, E484Q, D614G, P681R and Q1071H. The substitution T95I has also been detected in some but not all sequences for this lineage.

Concepts.definition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 where the following variations in the spike glycoprotein sequence have been identified: amino acid substitutions G142D, E154K, L452R, E484Q, D614G, P681R and Q1071H. The substitution T95I has also been detected in some but not all sequences for this lineage.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 where the following variations in the spike glycoprotein sequence have been identified: amino acid substitutions L452R, E484Q and D614G.

Concepts.definition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 where the following variations in the spike glycoprotein sequence have been identified: amino acid substitutions L452R, E484Q and D614G.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 where the following variations in the spike glycoprotein sequence have been identified: deletion of the amino acids at position 144 and amino acid substitutions D80G, F157S, L452R, D614G and D950H. The substitutions T791I and T859N have also been detected in some but not all sequences for this lineage.

Concepts.definition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 where the following variations in the spike glycoprotein sequence have been identified: deletion of the amino acids at position 144 and amino acid substitutions D80G, F157S, L452R, D614G and D950H. The substitutions T791I and T859N have also been detected in some but not all sequences for this lineage.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 where the following variations in the spike glycoprotein sequence have been identified: amino acid substitutions T95I, D253G and D614G. The substitutions L5F, S477N, E484K and A701V have also been detected in some but not all sequences for this lineage.

Concepts.definition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 where the following variations in the spike glycoprotein sequence have been identified: amino acid substitutions T95I, D253G and D614G. The substitutions L5F, S477N, E484K and A701V have also been detected in some but not all sequences for this lineage.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 where the following variations in the spike glycoprotein sequence have been identified: deletions of the amino acids at positions 69, 70 and 144 and amino acid substitutions A67V, E484K, D614G, Q677H and F888L.

Concepts.definition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 where the following variations in the spike glycoprotein sequence have been identified: deletions of the amino acids at positions 69, 70 and 144 and amino acid substitutions A67V, E484K, D614G, Q677H and F888L.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 where the following variations in the spike glycoprotein sequence have been identified: amino acid substitutions S13I, W152C, L452R and D614G.

Concepts.definition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 where the following variations in the spike glycoprotein sequence have been identified: amino acid substitutions S13I, W152C, L452R and D614G.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 where the following variations in the spike glycoprotein sequence have been identified: amino acid substitutions L452R and D614G.

Concepts.definition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 where the following variations in the spike glycoprotein sequence have been identified: amino acid substitutions L452R and D614G.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 where the following variations in the spike glycoprotein sequence have been identified: deletions of the amino acids at positions 241-242 and amino acid substitutions D80A, D215G, K417N, E484K, N501Y, D614G and A701V.

Concepts.definition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 where the following variations in the spike glycoprotein sequence have been identified: deletions of the amino acids at positions 241-242 and amino acid substitutions D80A, D215G, K417N, E484K, N501Y, D614G and A701V.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 where the following variations in the spike glycoprotein sequence have been identified: deletions of the amino acids at positions 69, 70 and 144 and amino acid substitutions N501Y, A570D, D614G, P681H, T716I, S982A and D1118H. The substitutions E484K, S494P and K1191N have also been detected in some but not all sequences for this lineage.

Concepts.definition: A variant lineage of SARS coronavirus 2 where the following variations in the spike glycoprotein sequence have been identified: deletions of the amino acids at positions 69, 70 and 144 and amino acid substitutions N501Y, A570D, D614G, P681H, T716I, S982A and D1118H. The substitutions E484K, S494P and K1191N have also been detected in some but not all sequences for this lineage.
